articles.author: Vaishnavi Mishra
articles.title: NASA’s oldest serving astronaut returns to Earth on 70th birthday
articles.content: NASA’s oldest serving astronaut Don Pettit has returned to Earth on his 70th birthday after concluding a seven-month science mission aboard the International Space Station.  Don, along with Roscosmos cosmonauts Alexey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner, landed in Kazakhstan on Sunday aboard Soyuz MS-26. Pettit has logged 590 days in orbit throughout his career and this one was his fourth spaceflight.

articles.author: Pravel Jain
articles.title: Barack & Michelle Obama 'married the wrong people': Megyn Kelly
articles.content: American journalist Megyn Kelly said former US President Barack Obama and his wife Michelle "married the wrong people". Stating that she believes the two are not a good match, the 54-year-old added, "Every word Michelle says about Barack is negative." "Every time she opines, it's something that reflects poorly on him," Megyn further said. The duo got married in 1992.

articles.author: Girish Kumar Anshul
articles.title: We offer opportunities if you follow law: US to Indian students
articles.content: US State Department warned international students, including Indians, of strict action for violating laws. Spokesperson Margaret MacLeod said, "If you follow the law...America offers opportunities. But those who break the law will face the consequences." This came after several Indian students reported that their F-1 visas had been revoked. India's MEA had said it is looking into the matter.

articles.author: Medhaa Gupta
articles.title: How is saying 'please', 'thank you' to ChatGPT costing OpenAI 'millions of dollars'?
articles.content: According to a Goldman Sachs report, each query posed to ChatGPT uses 2.9 watt-hours of electricity. Considering its number of users, OpenAI's energy use would reportedly total around 2.9 million kilowatt-hours per day. Recently, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said using phrases like 'please' and 'thank you' with ChatGPT is costing OpenAI "tens of millions of dollars".

articles.author: Anmol Sharma
articles.title: 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre becomes youngest cricketer to play for CSK in IPL history
articles.content: Batter Ayush Mhatre on Sunday became the youngest cricketer to play for CSK in the history of IPL. Mhatre, who is 17 years and 278 days old, debuted for CSK in their IPL 2025 match against MI on Sunday. Abhinav Mukund held the previous record after debuting for CSK at the age of 18 years and 139 days in 2008.
